articles.author: John Wagner
articles.title: Fetterman to hold first campaign rally since suffering a stroke in May
articles.description: Pennsylvania Lt. Gov. John Fetterman, who suffered a stroke in May and has been recovering, will hold his first campaign rally next week in Erie County. Fetterman has held some fundraisers, but this would be his first major public event.
articles.content:

articles.title: Texas governor sends migrants to New York City as immigration standoff accelerates
articles.description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott, a Republican, said on Friday he has started to send buses carrying migrants to New York City in an effort to push responsibility for border crossers to Democratic mayors and U.S. President Joe Biden, a Democrat.

articles.title: Parkland Trial Reveals Depths of Families’ Sorrow
articles.description: The rare trial of a gunman in a mass shooting has underscored how massacres shatter families and communities over time.

articles.title: Wisconsin couple dead after lightning strike Thursday near White House
articles.description: Four people had been critically hurt in the strike in Lafayette Square. Two are dead, and two remain in critical condition, police said.

articles.title: White House summoned Chinese ambassador to condemn provocations after Pelosi's Taiwan visit

articles.title: DeSantis suspends elected prosecutor over new abortion law
articles.description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) — Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis suspended the elected state prosecutor of Tampa on Thursday for pledging not to enforce the state's new 15-week abortion  ban and for supporting gender transition treatments for minors.

articles.author: Mostafa Salem, Ehsan Popalzai, Paul P. Murphy and Ivana Kottasová, CNN
articles.title: Taliban claim they weren't aware al Qaeda chief was living in Kabul
articles.description: The Taliban have claimed they were not aware that al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri was residing in the Afghan capital of Kabul where the US said he was killed in a drone strike over the weekend.
articles.content: The Taliban have claimed they were not aware that al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri was residing in the Afghan capital of Kabul where the US said he was killed in a drone strike over the weekend.
